hook.text: The order you withdraw from accounts can save or cost tens of thousands in taxes.

buildup.text: In retirement, you likely have taxable, tax-deferred, and tax-free accounts. Each is taxed differently.

discovery.text: A common strategy: withdraw from taxable accounts first, then tax-deferred, then Roth last.

twist.text: But filling low tax brackets with tax-deferred withdrawals early can reduce lifetime taxes significantly.

climax.text: Roth conversions in low-income years can shift money from taxable to tax-free forever.

punchline.text: In retirement, tax planning IS financial planning.

quiz.question: Why does withdrawal order matter in retirement?
options: Different accounts are taxed differently, affecting total taxes paid
It determines your Social Security amount
